title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: big rise in north yorkshire households facing fuel poverty .
new head of sheffield city region elected .
inquests start into leeds crash which killed five .
man seriously hurt in sheffield city centre stabbing .
man wanted on human trafficking conviction arrested .
minicab drivers hold leeds rush hour 'go-slow ' .
man , 35 , hit by goods vehicle in early hours .
thieves target nursery and steal electrical goods .
a trail of frozen art found on york streets .
sheffield exhibition aims to break baby loss taboo .

documents.title: that 's all from monday
text: those are all our updates from across yorkshire on monday 11 december 2017 .
want to find out what 's happening where you live on tuesday 12 december ?
just click here .

documents.title: wakefield 's wood extends deal to 2020
text: wakefield 's wood extends deal to 2020

documents.title: dog appeal for boy who could die in sleep
text: dog appeal for boy who could die in sleep

documents.title: santa 's helicopter hos visit
text: santa 's helicopter hos visit

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow .

documents.title: santa 's helicopter hos visit
text: santa 's helicopter hos visit

documents.title: listen : york uk snooker venue 'more popular than ever '
text: the organisers of the uk snooker championship which has been taking place over the past 12 days in york say it 's been another huge success .
history was made at the barbican last night as ronnie o'sullivan equalled steve davis ' record of six uk championship wins with a 10-5 victory over shaun murphy .
ivan hirschowitz is from world snooker .
he says the tournamnet in york gets more popular every year :

documents.title: fancy an adrenaline-filled adventure in sheffield ?
text: tourism body , marketing sheffield has been awarded £ 500,000 from visitengland to promote adrenaline-fuelled city breaks .
visitors will be able to book packages including accommodation , food and drink , nightlife and adventure sports activities .
it 's a pilot scheme targeted at young active explorers from germany , the netherlands and nordic countries .

documents.title: travel update : motorway problems in west yorkshire
text: it 's not looking like a great commute home on the m1/m62 tonight .
there are more than eight miles of queues on the m1 after an accident at j40 southbound and now there been a two-car crash on the m62 eastbound :
one lane blocked and heavy traffic due to accident , two vehicles involved on m62 eastbound at j29 m1 ( lofthouse ) .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: woman sprayed in the face during sheffield attack
text: a woman was pushed over and kicked several times before being sprayed in the face with a `` substance '' and robbed in sheffield yesterday .
the 44-year-old was walking away from meadowhall and under the m1 at 12:50 , when her attackers came up from behind and pushed her to the floor .
she was then kicked several times and two men tried to take her rucksack - she was also sprayed in the face with a substance before the men left .
they took a small amount of cash from her and she suffered cuts and bruises but was n't seriously injured .
we are unsure of the nature of the substance that was sprayed in her face other than it was described as smelling like nail polish remover .
fortunately , it has not caused any lasting damage ''

documents.title: crowds see city 's iced gems on trail
text: crowds see city 's iced gems on trail

documents.title: buddy the raccoon dog rescued from icy water
text: buddy the raccoon dog had a lucky escape this afternoon after he fell into a north yorkshire canal .
fire crews were called out after he was stranded on the ice on the leeds liverpool canal at skipton and then fell through to the icy cold water below .
firefighters used poles and `` manpower '' to get hold of buddy and safely reunite him with his owner .
be warned though if you fancy getting your own buddy , the rspca issued a warning earlier this year highlighting that raccoon dogs do n't make good pets .

documents.title: leeds agree deal for midfielder ideguchi
text: leeds agree deal for midfielder ideguchi

documents.title: watch : private hire drivers stage protest in leeds
text: this morning some private hire drivers in leeds staged a go-slow drive around the centre of leeds .
the drivers say they want the right to work in unmarked cars as they say their safety is at risk from people who throw bricks at minicabs .
the protest caused extensive delays for drivers heading into the city , especially on kirkstall road .

documents.title: man dies as car leaves a170 road near kirkbymoorside
text: a man in his 20s has died after an accident on the a170 near kirkbymoorside .
the accident happened at 20:30 on saturday when a blue vw polo was travelling towards pickering and left the road near the junction with appleton-le-moors .
north yorkshire police say it went down an embankment before stopping in a field .
the man , who officers say is thought to be from the pickering area , died at the scene and police are looking for any witnesses .

documents.title: paying mothers can 'incentivise breastfeeding '
text: paying mothers can 'incentivise breastfeeding '
author: Katie Silver
Health reporter, BBC News

documents.title: cash boost for doncaster friendship scheme
text: a doncaster charity has been given nearly £ 250,000 to help older people in the area who are suffering loneliness .
be friend matches volunteer befrienders with isolated elderly neighbours .
they estimate around one in four older people in the doncaster area are very lonely .

documents.title: efit : bradford couple in 90s robbed by bogus workmen
text: police want to speak to this man after a couple in their 90s had personal items and £ 1,500 cash taken by bogus workmen .
the theft happened in the east bowling area of bradford on 20 november when two men called at their house and offered to work on the couple 's guttering .
one man asked the couple to go to the rear of their house when a second man got in through the unlocked front door .
after the men had left the couple dicovered that a safe , which contained personal items and about £ 1,500 had gone missing .
this was a des crime carried out against a vulnerable couple and we are keen to hear from anyone who may recognise this male ''

documents.title: historical military bridge dismantled for renovation
text: one of the last surviving military bridges used to access raf sandtoft near doncaster has been removed .
the inglis bridge is believed to be the only surviving mark 1 version and was installed at the former world war ii airfield sometime in 1943/44 .
this bridge , which has not been used since the end of world war ii , will be renovated by the royal engineers association at the army base in nottingham .
a partial segment of the bridge will be sent to the royal engineers museum in gillingham , kent when renovations are completed .

documents.title: travel update : further delays hit leeds buses
text: following the earlier protest by private hire drivers in leeds it looks like it 's not a happy day if you 're using the buses :
various buses - leeds - services were slowly recovering from earlier delays but now have been hit with extra school run traffic congestion in and around leeds and started losing time again .
current delays of up to 25mins across leeds ( up to 40min to service 16 ) ^vl
are any services actually running ?
just another excuse for the consistent poor service ?
hi , we do have many busses running throughout west yorkshire .
would you like me to track a service for you ? ^jr
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: do you know this man ? police are looking for him
text: do you know this man ?
police want to speak to him after parked cars were damaged in doncaster .
the incidents happened at about 04:50 on on 2 december when was seen carrying a breeze block into a car park near the railway station .
the man smashed the windscreen of a red toyota yaris and then grabbed the wing mirror of a blue vauxhall zafira and hit and kicked it .

documents.title: new head of sheffield city region elected
text: the leader of rotherham metropolitan borough council chris read has been elected as the new chair of sheffield city region combined authority .

mr read takes over from sir steve houghton , the leader of barnsley council , who announced in july that he was stepping down temporarily because of a conflict of interest over the best devolution deal for south yorkshire .
sir steve wanted to pursue a yorkshire-wide deal instead of the sheffield city region agreement .
he 's now been replaced permanently following the election of chris read .

documents.title: watch : a trail of frozen art found on york streets
text: remember we told you about a frozen viking ice sculpture in york earlier .
he was part the york ice trail which featured 45 sculptures , formed from crystal-clear ice , dotted about the city .
the works of frozen art provided plenty of photo opportunities for those on a cold trawl around the shops in search of christmas presents :

documents.title: carvalhal given one-game touchline ban
text: sheffield wednesday manager carlos carvalhal has been given a one match touchline ban after his dismissal during the draw with hull city .
the owls ' head coach was sent to the stands after arguing with officials over a penalty decision .
he will miss friday 's game against league leaders wolverhampton wanderers .
he has also been fined £ 3,000 .
author: Jonathan Buchan
BBC Radio Sheffield Sport

documents.title: 60 bags of s found in drugs raid
text: sixty bags of the drug s were found in a raid by police in south yorkshire .
police were carrying out specialist operations in doncaster town centre after a rise in reported drug use .
a team , including a drug detection dog have carried out spot checks and targeted patrols in the market place , bowers fold and around the interchange and issued a number of cautions .
officers who were executing a drugs warrant in bowers fold found 60 bags of what is believed to be the drug s along with other drug equipment .
a 23-year-old man and two women , aged 21 and 18 were arrested in connection with the inquiry .
they have since been released under investigation .

documents.title: heckingbottom 'close ' to new deal with barnsley
text: it 's understood that barnsley fc manager , paul heckingbottom , is close to signing a new deal with the club .
forty-year-old heckingbottom has guided the reds to promotion and championship safety since becoming caretaker manager in february 2016 .
the appointment was made permanent in june that year .
talks between the manager and the club opened some weeks ago and it 's believed an announcement is expected before the end of the week .
author: Andy Giddings
Sports Editor, BBC Sheffield

documents.title: thieves target nursery and steal electrical goods
text: police have released cctv images of people they want to find after a nursery was burgled in a village near halifax .
ovenden children 's nursery was broken into in the early hours of tuesday , 28 november .
the suspects took a number of ipad minis and other electrical goods from the nursery .
west yorkshire police say they want to speak to anyone who knows who the men in the images are or have been offered an ipad mini to buy .

documents.title: travel update : problems persist after private hire protest
text: private hire drivers protested in leeds this morning by staging a go-slow drive around the centre of the city .
things are still not back to normal :
many services still failed to fully recover from the extreme delays caused by private hire cars protest .
delays of up to 50min across leeds network currently .
further cancellations expected .
^jr
so its a normal day then ! panic over.1,2,3 lets all laugh together now
always great at blaming others for delays .
one day they may admit they 're just crap .
on that day , i anticipate low flying pigs and hell freezing over - both of which will then get the blame for delays and cancellations
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: man , 35 , hit by goods vehicle in early hours
text: a 35-year-old man is seriously ill in hospital after he was hit by a goods vehicle on the a635 dearne valley parkway in the early hours of this morning .
the white daf articulated vehicle was heading towards doncaster at about 01:10 and was close to the hollygrove roundabout when it hit the man .
the driver of the goods vehicle was unhurt .

documents.title: man wanted on human trafficking conviction arrested
text: a man wanted by police in hungary for human trafficking and theft has been arrested in west yorkshire .
attila foeldesi , 45 , is the subject of a european arrest warrant after being found guilty of the offences .
he was sentenced to over five years in prison for the crimes .
police said they believed that foeldesi had been living in the beeston area of leeds but that he could have had contacts across west yorkshire .

documents.title: north yorkshire police officers make 'arresting ' find
text: police work in england 's biggest county is n't all about catching criminals , as this tweet proves :
this little fella was rescued by one of our officers on friday evening after being struck by a vehicle between richmond and catterick garrison .
he wrapped it up in his fleece , and took it home where he will remain until he 's well enough to be released back in to the wild .
@ twitterid is this you again ?
i seem to remember there 's a on your office wall of a little rescued owl sitting in a traffic cap !
# owlrescuer

documents.title: in sheffield fire crews tackle titanium blaze
text: south yorkshire fire and rescue service has just released from a titanium fire at the weekend in sheffield :
it happened in the early hours of saturday morning on sussex street where an `` unknown quantity '' of loose titanium was well alight when fire crews arrived .
the fire had spread to a lorry and two forklift trucks and the flames were so fierce they had caused heat damage to nearby buildings .
fire officers say the cause of the fire is believed to be accidental and possibly as a result of the titanium overheating after being dried and then stored .

documents.title: snow and ice disrupt sheffield bin collections
text: veolia , who manage waste services for sheffield city council , are warning that difficult conditions on roads and footpaths caused by the wintry weather mean only limited bin collections are being carried out today .
veolia say : `` we apologise for any inconvenience caused .
where safe to do so , residents are advised to leave their bin/box out until they have been emptied . ''

documents.title: castleford sign rhinos half-back aston
text: castleford sign rhinos half-back aston

documents.title: travel update : accident on m62
text: one to watch out for if you 're heading that way :
2 vehicle rtc on slip road of m621/m62 heading east - log 587 11/12/17 refers
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: introducing christmas music in york
text: some of york 's best known musicians and singers are performing a host of christmas carols at the weekend , to raise money for children in need .
they 're taking to the alter in the city 's holy trinity church on micklegate on saturday .
doors open at 19:00 and the show starts at 19:30 prompt .
the festive musicathon is free , but donations are welcomed and encouraged for children in need .
author: Jericho Keys
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: watch : leeds cat cafe opens doors
text: if you 're looking for a purr-fect cuppa and visit this place you could end up , ahem , feline fine ?
a former bank on kirkgate in leeds city centre has been transformed into a cat cafe which opens today .
it 's home to around 35 rescue cats , for customers to pet while eating .
katie charles-richards , owner of kitty cafe , said the cats were all rescued from local shelters and could be adopted :

documents.title: there 's only one team in 'shefield '
text: sheffield united has taken its official calendar off sale in the club shop after a rather embarrassing spelling mistake was discovered .
the back page displays the heading `` shefield united fc '' .
sheffield wednesday fans were n't slow to poke fun at their rivals ' spelling mistake as this tweet shows .
sheffield united says the final proof for the calendar was correct when it was signed-off by the club and the error crept in afterwards .
grange communications , who handle the printing and distribution for the club , have issued an `` unreserved apology '' .
wen yor offishul calindar is n't pruferead # swfc

documents.title: teenager 'critical ' after being hit by car in ripon
text: a teenage boy has been seriously injured in a collision in ripon this morning .
the 14-year-old pedestrian was hit by a car on clotherholme road , near the junction of aislabie garth , as he walked to school at about 08:45 .
the boy 's condition is currently described as `` critical '' .
his family has been informed and is currently with him in hospital .
anyone with information about the incident is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: inquests open into car crash deaths
text: inquests open into car crash deaths

documents.title: new weekend services on east coast mainline
text: a total of 24 new train services are to run on the east coast mainline on saturdays , it 's been announced .

virgin trains says it 's increasing the capacity as part of a £ 140m investment on the 393-mile long line which runs between london and edinburgh , passing through doncaster , wakefield , leeds , york and northallerton .
the company has also introduced an 04:40 morning service from york to london on weekdays .
virgin says it 's being introduced after calls from members of the business community who want to get to the capital for early meetings .

documents.title: in york viking freezes as temperatures plummet
text: it 's so cold in york at the moment that this old viking 's frozen solid !
the 2m high frosty figure is actually part of the york ice trail which was on in the city at the weekend .
he was joined by 45 other sculptures formed from crystal clear ice sprinkled across york .

documents.title: man seriously hurt in sheffield stabbing
text: a man 's in a serious condition in hospital after being stabbed in sheffield at the weekend .
the 38-year-old victim was found with stab wounds in arundel gate just after 18:05 on saturday .
it 's thought the incident happened outside the nearby mulberry tavern .
police say that `` extensive enquiries '' are ongoing in the area and anyone with information about the stabbing is being asked to get in touch .

documents.title: travel update : go-slow causing major problems in leeds
text: some private hire drivers in leeds are staging a go-slow around leeds city centre this morning .
the a65 into the centre is severely affected with tailbacks reaching as far as horsforth , which is about five miles from the city centre :
the drivers say they want the right to work in unmarked cars as they say their safety is at risk from people who throw bricks at minicabs .
the protest was due to end at 10:00 , but knock-on tailbacks will be a problem for some time .
large parts of the city have been brought to a standstill , even parts which were not on the route of the minicab drivers .
this is eastgate in the east of the city :
buses : - the go-slow private hire protest in leeds is now causing delays of up to 1h 15 mins to most services operating in leeds .
services 33/33a are the worst affected and are currently running almost 2 hours late.^df
is this still affecting services ?
hi , it was supposed to finish at 10.00 but due to a high volume of vehicles on the road there are still delays with this service .

documents.title: pedestrian seriously hurt on m1 slip road
text: a 23-year-old man was seriously hurt when he was hit by a car in south yorkshire at the weekend .
it happened at about 12:20 on saturday morning when a silver kia cee 'd collided with a pedestrian who 's thought to have been on the m1 northbound entry slip road at junction 31 .
the man was taken to hospital where he 's being treated for potentially life-threatening injuries .
the driver of the kia , a 19-year-old woman , was not injured .
police say they want to hear from anyone who saw what happened or who thinks they may have seen the pedestrian before the collision .

documents.title: fire service body camera trial shelved
text: plans for firefighters in bradford to become the first across west yorkshire to wear body cameras in a bid to reduce attacks on crews have been shelved after a fire authority committee refused to sanction a proposed trial of the scheme .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: sheffield exhibition aims to break baby loss taboo
text: silent taboos around stillbirth and miscarriage are the focus of an exhibition exploring how parents and medics deal with early-life baby loss .
the exhibition , at the art house in sheffield , uses visual and audio art to explore how both parents and medical staff experience and encounter death `` at the very beginning of life '' .
academics from the university of sheffield worked with the charities sands and the lullaby trust on the project and interviewed families who have lost a baby .
parents were invited to take part in a workshop where personal objects relating to their baby 's death were transformed into artwork for the exhibition .

documents.title: listen : fuel poverty rise - 'it 's easier to not eat '
text: there 's been a significant rise in the number of households in north yorkshire having to choose whether to spend money on food or heat their homes .
in the last three years , fuel poverty in the county has gone up by about 10,000 households , to nearly 40,000 , according to government figures .
this grandmother from york , who did n't want to be named , says she struggles to afford to heat her home :
author: BBC Radio York

documents.title: watch : yorkshire 's monday forecast
text: today will be generally dry in yorkshire but very cold with some sunshine in the west , but cloudier in the east .
watch my forecast here :
author: Abbie Dewhurst
Weather Presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch out for black ice
text: if you need to head over the hills towards manchester this morning , the gritters have been out overnight and the major routes are open .
snow has been cleared but now the concern is about road surface temperatures below freezing which could lead to black ice on some routes .
i drove over snake pass to south yorkshire this morning and the road was clear , but my car thermometer was reading -3.5c ( 26f ) on the summit of the pass .
this was the scene :
my advice is to take it steady , especially around the bends , and you should n't have a problem .
the m62 and woodhead pass are also both open .
author: Wendy Middleton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: regions divided over christmas costs
text: people in less affluent parts of the country spend more as a proportion of their income on christmas , analysis by the bbc indicates .
the north east , west midlands , northern ireland and yorkshire and the humber region spend 25 % of a month 's disposable income .
but in london and the south east , that falls to below 20 % .
the analysis by bbc 5 live 's wake up to money matched official regional income figures with centre for retail research spending forecasts for christmas .
separate figures from yougov show wealthier people are cutting back on christmas and plan to spend less on gifts this year , down 8 % , at £ 300 , compared to £ 291 for lower earners , up 4 % .
author: James Graham
Journalist, BBC Radio5live

documents.title: inquests to start into leeds crash which killed five
text: the inquests into the deaths of five people , including three children , in a car crash in leeds last month is due to open later .
ellis and elliott thornton-kimmitt , who were 12 and 14 , died along with darnell harte , who was 15 , and anthony armour and robbie meerun , who were 24 .
a 15-year-old boy 's been charged with causing death by dangerous driving .

documents.title: in snowy scenes across yorkshire
text: from a snowy milkman in hawes , north yorkshire , to near whiteout conditions in holmfirth , west yorkshire , you 've been out and about capturing the snowy weekend on camera :

documents.title: tibetan monks bless proposed rotherham fracking site
text: buddhist monks have visited rotherham to perform a special blessing on land earmarked for fracking .
the gyuto monks , who live in exile in india alongside the dalai lama , were invited to woodsetts at the weekend to support anti-fracking campaigners .
energy firm ineos has submitted plans to drill an exploration well for shale gas on land south of dinnington road .
campaigners said the `` land puja ceremony '' was intended to restore peace and harmony to the land and village .
matthew wilkinson , from woodsetts against fracking , said the monks visit was aimed at raising global awareness of their campaign .
earlier this year , ineos was granted temporary injunctions to prevent disruption by anti-fracking protesters at their sites across the country , including the one at woodsetts .
mr wilkinson said careful consideration had been taken to ensure the monks ' visit would not be in breach of that injunction .

documents.title: check your rail journey this morning
text: if you 're heading out to catch the train this morning , despite the cold temperatures so far they seem to be generally running on time from railway stations across yorkshire .
we 'll keep you informed , but you can keep an eye on journeys by clicking on the links below .
keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: snooker history made in york
text: snooker history was made at the barbican in york last night as ronnie o'sullivan equalled steve davis ' record of six uk championship wins with a 10-5 victory over shaun murphy .
the event has been staged in york since 2011 .

o'sullivan , 42 , matched two snooker records as he equalled steve davis ' tally of six uk titles and stephen hendry 's record of 18 victories in `` triple crown '' events - the uk and world championships and masters .
davis said : `` on his day , he is not just the most mercurial and most amazing talent we have ever seen , he is also one of the greatest winning machines we have had . ''

documents.title: reminder to take care on south yorkshire 's icy roads
text: it may seem like stating the obvious on this freezing yorkshire morning , but it 's worth repeating the warnings to be careful out there .
sheffield city council has this to say to drivers in south yorkshire :
we can not guarantee treated roads will be completely ice free .

documents.title: minicab drivers plan leeds rush hour 'go-slow '
text: minicab drivers in west yorkshire are planning to hold a rush hour go-slow protest in leeds this morning as they call for the right to work in unmarked cars .
they say there have been several recent incidents involving bricks being thrown at marked taxis and minicabs .
west yorkshire police says there are no circumstances where cabs should be unmarked because it 'd be unsafe for passengers and could put children at risk of being sexually exploited .
but ahmad hussain , from leeds private hire drivers association , says the drivers `` want to be heard '' .
`` we 'll be starting off on kirkstall road and we 'll be doing a slow protest driving through the city , '' says mr hussain .
`` it 's to make it known that we want a change .
we 're not asking for anything more than what we deserve , '' he adds .

documents.title: monday 's chilly weather forecast for yorkshire
text: a mainly dry , but very cold day , with periods of winter sunshine in the west and some wintry showers in the east .
there 'll be a widespread frost at first , with temperatures struggling to climb above freezing during the day .
this evening there 'll be a widespread frost again , with some wintry showers persisting along the coast through much of the night , but easing by dawn .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: appeal over missing shipley man
text: have you seen jordan line ?
the 23-year-old 's been missing from his home in shipley in west yorkshire since sunday morning .
he was last seen in the pratt lane at about 08:30 yesterday and police say they 're `` particularly concerned '' for his current welfare .
mr line is described as white , about 5ft 11ins tall , of medium build , with short straight brown hair .
he was wearing blue jeans and a light blue shirt and he may have also have been wearing a dark jacket .
anyone with information about his whereabouts is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on monday 11 december 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 , with all the latest news , travel , sport and weather updates from across yorkshire .
winter is certainly making itself felt across yorkshire at the moment .
of course , it can be a huge inconvenience , but it certainly makes things look nice
here 's the ribblehead viaduct in north yorkshire bathed in morning sunlight as snow caused by an arctic airflow came down in the wake of storm caroline at the weekend .
if you 'd like to share any of your wintry photos with the rest of yorkshire , you can send them in by simply clicking here .
we 'd love to see them !
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
